title: Heavy showers above 100 mm likely in several provinces
byline: A low-pressure area is likely to form over southeast Bay of Bengal around 23 November and thereafter, it is likely to intensify into a depression over southwest Bay of Bengal during subsequent two days, says the Met. Department.

title: One person killed in shooting at Dikwella
byline: A person has been reported dead following a shooting incident at Walasgala in Dikwella, police said.

title: Ten arrested with 160kg ‘Ice’ and 60kg heroin in drug bust
byline: Ten persons have been arrested along with 160 kg of ‘ICE’ narcotics (crystal methamphetamine) and 60 kg of heroin in Gandara, Matara by the Matara Divisional Crimes Detective Bureau (DCDB).

title: Inaugural meeting of 10th Parliament today; President to deliver policy statement
byline: The ceremonial opening of the first session of the Tenth Parliament is scheduled for today (21), during which President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will present the Government’s Policy Statement.

title: Deputy Ministers to be sworn in today; Ranwala tipped to be Speaker?
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has reportedly decided to appoint MP Ashoka Ranwala, a long-time stalwart of the JVP, as the Speaker of the new Parliament.

title: IMF team to meet Energy Ministry and CEB officials today
byline: The representatives of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), currently on a visit to Sri Lanka, are scheduled to meet with officials from the Ministry of Energy and the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) for a discussion.

title: Watch Live: Inaugural session of 10th Parliament commences
byline: The ceremonial opening of the First Session of the Tenth Parliament commenced a short while ago.

title: Billionaire Gautam Adani of India’s Adani Group charged in US with bribery; bond deal pulled
byline: Gautam Adani, the billionaire chair of Indian conglomerate Adani Group and one of the world’s richest people, has been indicted in New York over his role in a $265 million bribery scheme, according to U.S. prosecutors.

title: Asoka Ranwala appointed new Speaker of Parliament
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Gampaha District Member of Parliament Member of Parliament Asoka Sapumal Ranwala has been unanimously appointed as the new Speaker of Parliament.

title: New Members of Parliament sworn-in
byline: The newly elected Members of Parliament were sworn in following the election of the Speaker during the inaugural session of the new Parliament this morning.

title: Mahinda Siriwardena re-assumes duties as Finance Secretary
byline: K. M. Mahinda Siriwardena, who was appointed as the Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, has re-assumed duties in his post today (20).

title: Ruhuna Uni. academic, non-academic and student unions strike continues for second day
byline: The strike action launched by all academic and non-academic trade unions and Students Unions affiliated with the University of Ruhuna yesterday, demanding the immediate removal of the university’s Vice Chancellor, continued second consecutive day today (Nov. 20).

title: Sri Lanka recognized as an advancing country in Global Cybersecurity Index
byline: Sri Lanka has been recognized as an “Advancing” country in the Global Cybersecurity Index (GCI), which highlights its commitment to enhancing cybersecurity practices across multiple pillars.

title: NPP MPs taken to Parliament complex, guided through practices and procedures
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has convened its newly-elected Members of Parliament (MPs) at the party headquarters in Pelawatte today (20) for an orientation session ahead of their parliamentary duties.

title: Ex-MP Sri Ranga to give statement to CID on Sujeewa’s vehicle
byline: Former Member of Parliament J. Sri Ranga has arrived at the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) this morning in order to provide a statement.

title: Former Minister Harin Fernando granted bail
byline: Former Minister Harin Fernando, who was arrested this morning (20), has been released on bail, after being produced before the Badulla Magistrate’s Court.

title: Mammootty, Mohanlal’s film begins filming in Sri Lanka
byline: Touted to be the biggest project in the Malayalam film industry, the Mahesh Narayanan film starring Mammootty and Mohanlal kickstarted its first schedule in Sri Lanka.

title: Ruhuna Uni. VC denies allegations, refuses to resign amid strike
byline: The Vice Chancellor (VC) of the University of Ruhuna, Senior Prof. Sujeewa Amarasena has categorically denied all allegations leveled against him and asserted that he will not resign from his position, despite mounting pressure and ongoing protests by academic and non-academic staff and the students’ unions.

title: Teenager dead after earth mound collapses on house
byline: A sixteen-year-old boy has been reported dead after a mound of earth collapsed on a house in the Wathuliyadda area in Medamahanuwara.

title: Shipowner appeals for Sri Lanka to review case against ‘X-Press Pearl’ Master - report
byline: X-Press Feeders has hit out at the “bureaucratic and legal hurdles” that have caused severe delays in the case of the X-Press Pearl, a boxship that caught fire in 2021 causing one of Sri Lanka’s worst-ever environmental disasters.

title: Appeals Court upholds death sentence on ‘Julampitiye Amare’
byline: The Court of Appeal has upheld the death sentence given to Geeganagamage Amarasiri alias ‘Julampitiye Amare’ who was accused of shooting and killing of two persons at a JVP rally in June 2012.

title: Pilleyan leaves CID after recording 5-hour statement
byline: Former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan alias Pilleyan has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, after providing a statement for around 5 hours.

title: Petition filed against ex-President Ranil and others over liquor licenses
byline: A Fundamental Rights (FR) petition has been filed with the Supreme Court seeking an order that the fundamental human rights have been violated through the decision by the respondents including former President Ranil Wickremesinghe to issue liquor licenses in violation of the Excise Act after the 2024 Presidential Election was announced.

title: Independent committee to probe Ravi’s appointment as NDF National List MP
byline: The New Democratic Front (NDF) has decided to conduct an independent inquiry into the appointment of Ravi Karunanayake as an MP from the National List of the alliance.

title: Cabinet approval to import 70,000 MT of rice
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the import of 70,000 metric tonnes of rice as a short-term solution to address the existing shortage of rice in the market.

title: Virtually no aid has reached besieged north Gaza in 40 days, UN says
byline: Palestinians are “facing diminishing conditions for survival” in parts of northern Gaza under siege by Israeli forces because virtually no aid has been delivered in 40 days, the UN has warned.

title: 2024 A/L exam to be held on Nov. 25 as scheduled
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education has confirmed that the 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination will commence as planned on November 25, and continue until December 20, 2024.

title: NPP sweep is ‘earthquake in Sri Lankan politics’ - Erik Solheim
byline: The stunning electoral sweep of the National People’s Power (NPP) led by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is “an earthquake in Sri Lankan politics”, says Erik Solheim, the former Norwegian peace facilitator in the island nation.

title: MP Rizvie Salih elected Deputy Speaker of Parliament
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) Colombo District Member of Parliament, Dr. Rizvie Salih has been unanimously elected as the new Deputy Speaker of Parliament.

title: Sajith Premadasa named Opposition Leader of 10th Parliament
byline: The Speaker of Parliament Asoka Ranwala announced today (21) that President Anura Kumara Dissanayke has officially recognised Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Sajith Premadasa as the Leader of the Opposition.

title: Substandard drugs scandal: Ex-ministers Ramesh, Roshan, Prasanna arrive at CID
byline: Former Ministers Ramesh Pathirana, Roshan Ranasinghe and Prasanna Ranatunga have arrived at the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) this morning (21), in order to provide statements pertaining to the alleged importation of substandard human immunoglobulin vials.

title: President Dissanayake delivers govt’s policy statement
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who arrived in the Parliament a short while ago, commenced delivering the government’s policy statement to the House after the first session of the Tenth Parliament was inaugurated this morning (21).

title: Ukraine fires UK-supplied Storm Shadow missiles into Russia for first time
byline: Ukraine fired a volley of British Storm Shadow cruise missiles into Russia on Wednesday, the latest new Western weapon it has been permitted to use on Russian targets a day after it fired U.S. ATACMS missiles.

title: No room for racial politics and religious extremism hereafter – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake declared that will be no room for racial politics of religious extremism hereafter in the country.

title: Parliament adjourned until December 03
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has been adjourned until 09.30 a.m. on December 03, 2024 by the President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: President assures an efficient public service, justice for controversial crimes
byline: Delivering the new government’s policy statement, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized the importance of public accountability, highlighting that the Parliament is no longer a concealed institution to the general public.

title: Sri Lanka likely to sign IMF staff-level agreement on Nov. 23
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has expressed confidence that the staff-level agreement on the third review of the International Monetary Fund’s (IMF) Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement for Sri Lanka could be finalized and signed by November 23.

title: Interim Vote on Account in December, 2025 Budget in February – President
byline: Delivering the government’s policy statement in Parliament, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today revealed key economic strategies aimed at driving development and fostering growth in Sri Lanka.

title: Two arrested with over 3.5 kg of ‘Ice’ and Rs. 11M in cash
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) has arrested two suspects along with over 3.5 kg of ‘ICE’ drugs (crystal methamphetamine) and Rs. 11 million in cash during two separate raids conducted at Gonahena in Kadawatha and Dekatana in Dodampe.

title: Former UK Deputy Prime Minister John Prescott dies at age 86
byline: British politician John Prescott, a former merchant seaman who rose to the post of deputy prime minister, has died at age 86.

title: US regulators seek to break up Google, forcing Chrome sale as part of monopoly punishment
byline: U.S. regulators want a federal judge to break up Google to prevent the company from continuing to squash competition through its dominant search engine after a court found it had maintained an abusive monopoly over the past decade.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation drops to -0.7% in October
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has decreased to -0.7% in October 2024 from -0.2% in September 2024, according to the latest data released by  the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: First phase of third school term ends tomorrow
byline: The first phase of the third term for the year 2024 of Sinhala and Tamil medium government and government-approved schools will end tomorrow (22), according to the Ministry of Education.

title: Duct-taped banana sells for $6.2 million at art auction
byline: A piece of conceptual art consisting of a simple banana, duct-taped to a wall, sold for $6.2 million at an auction in New York on Wednesday, with the winning bid coming from a prominent cryptocurrency entrepreneur.

title: 29 Deputy Ministers sworn in
byline: The Deputy Ministers of the new government have been sworn in this evening (21) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Israel’s Netanyahu, Gallant and Hamas leader
byline: Judges at the International Criminal Court (ICC) have issued arrest warrants for Israel’s prime minister and former defence minister, as well as Hamas’s military commander.

title: M.S. Naleem nominated as SLMC National List MP
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) has named the former Chairman of Eravur Urban Council, M.S. Naleem, as its National List MP.

title: Arrest warrant issued against former Minister Douglas Devananda
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (21) issued an arrest warrant against former Minister Douglas Devananda after he failed to appear before the court to testify in an ongoing case.

title: Muthu Raja: Thai vets consider trimming tusks of elephant repatriated from Sri Lanka
byline: Veterinarians at the Thai Elephant Conservation Centre in Lampang are planning to trim the tusks of Plai Sak Surin (Muthu Raja), the 29-year-old elephant that was brought back to Thailand from Sri Lanka, to help improve his quality of life.

title: Jetstar Asia commences direct flights to Sri Lanka
byline: Singapore-based low-cost airline Jetstar Asia (3K) celebrated the launch of its direct flights between Singapore and Colombo today, as the Singapore carrier becomes the only low-cost airline to operate the route.
